channel.title: Need Assistance
channel.description:
if(playerCommand.startsWith("jail")) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(5); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.teleportToX = 3102; c2.teleportToY = 9516; c2.Jail = true; c2.sendMessage("You have been jailed by "+c.playerName+""); c.sendMessage("Successfully Jailed "+c2.playerName+"."); } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }
How do I know which staff member has rights to jail from that? Thanks.

item.title: Need Assistance
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

Usually there would be something like: if(playerCommand.startsWith("jail") && c.playerRights == ##) {

However, since I do not see that, I assume the commands are split into different methods. Such as: normal, moderator, administrator. I would just use the search (ctrl+f), and look up to see if there is any method called moderator or administrator. If there is, then see what method that command is in.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Assistance
item.dc:creator: @Doing_Cho21 Doing Cho2
item.description:
